sense.def:
To look in a particular direction
pomeni obrniti pogled v določeno smer, da bi videli, kaj je tam.

seg.quote: She turned to look out of the window.
They looked at each other.
He blushed and looked away.
Take a good look.
Did you have a look at the shop?

sense.def:
To look at something
pomeni nekaj prebrati, preučiti ali razmisliti o tistem.

seg.quote: ‘I'd like to look at his medical history,’ Percival said.
Let's look at the implications of these changes.
Tony, I've had a look at that book you wrote.

sense.def:
To look at a situation from a particular point of view
pomeni okoliščine presojati z določenega gledišča.

seg.quote: If you're a Democrat, you look at things one way, and if you're a Republican you look at them very differently.

sense.def:
Z izazom
look
povemo, kakšno se nam nekaj zdi.

seg.quote: The plan looks impressive enough on paper.
Looks as if we're going to be late.
It looks like a good book.

sense.def:
To give someone a particular kind of look
pomeni nekoga pogledati tako, da se vidi, kaj mislimo.

seg.quote: Don't give me such severe looks. What have I done?

sense.def:
Z izrazom
look
opišemo zunanjost nekoga ali nečesa. Na primer: kadar nekaj
looks nice
, je prijetnega videza.

seg.quote: You look very pale.
He looked as if he hadn't slept very much.
‘What does he look like?’—‘Pale, thin, dark-haired.’

sense.def:
Kadar ima nekdo ali nekaj
a particular look
, ima določeno zunanjost ali izraz.

seg.quote: He didn't have the look of a man who was thinking.
There is a nervous look in their eyes.

sense.def:
Izraz
one's looks
uporabimo, kadar mislimo na to, kako je nekdo lep ali čeden.

seg.quote: She had lost her looks.
I didn't marry him for his looks.

sense.def:
Kadar okno, soba ali stavba
looks out onto something
, ima razgled na nekaj.

seg.quote: The kitchen window looks out onto a yard.

sense.def:
‘Look’
ali
‘look here’
rečemo, kadar želimo nekoga opozoriti na tisto, kar govorimo.

seg.quote: Look, Mrs Kintner, you've got it wrong.

sense.def:
Izraz
look
uporabljamo tudi z besedami, kot so
who
,
what
ali
at
, da pritegnemo pozornost na nekaj, na primer kadar smo jezni ali presenečeni.

seg.quote: Now look what you've done.
Goodness, look at the time. I promised I'd be home at six.

sense.def:
To look after someone or something
pomeni skrbeti za nekoga ali nekaj.

seg.quote: Your husband ought to be looking after the baby.

sense.def:
To look after something
pomeni biti odgovoren za nekaj.

seg.quote: The duty of the local authority is to look after the interests of local people.

sense.def:
To look back
pomeni misliti na stvari, ki so se zgodile v preteklosti.

seg.quote: People can often look back and reflect on happy childhood memories.

sense.def:
To look down on someone
pomeni misliti, da je nekdo manjvreden.

cit.quote: zviška gledati na koga, zaničevati koga

seg.quote: Farm labourers used to be looked down on.

sense.def:
To look for someone or something
pomeni poskušati najti nekoga ali nekaj.

seg.quote: I've been looking for you.
She looked around for some paper.
...people looking for work.

sense.def:
To be looking forward to something
pomeni želeti, da bi se nekaj zgodilo.

seg.quote: I'm quite looking forward to it.
I look forward to seeing you.

sense.def:
To look into something
pomeni nekaj ugotoviti o nečem.

seg.quote: A working party was set up to look into the problem.

sense.def:
To look on
pomeni nekaj opazovati, medtem ko se dogaja.

seg.quote: His parents looked on with a triumphant smile.

sense.def:
To look on something as a particular thing
pomeni misliti, da je nekaj določena stvar.

seg.quote: She looked on us as idiots.

sense.def:
‘Look out’
rečemo, da bi nekoga opozorili pred nevarnostjo.

seg.quote: ‘Look out,’ I said. ‘There's something coming.’

sense.def:
To look out for something
pomeni potruditi se, da bi nekaj opazili.

seg.quote: It's a film we shall look out for in the next couple of months.

sense.def:
To look round a place
pomeni hoditi okoli nekega kraja in si ogledovati njegove različne dele.

seg.quote: Shall we look round the Cathedral this afternoon?

sense.def:
To look through something
pomeni nekaj preiskati, da bi našli, kar iščemo.

seg.quote: He looked through the clothing on the bed.

sense.def:
To look to someone for something
pomeni upati, da nam bo nekdo nekaj ponudil ali dal, na primer pomoč ali nasvet.

seg.quote: Many people in the community will be looking to us for leadership.

sense.def:
To look to the future
pomeni razmišljati o prihodnosti.

seg.quote: Some New Englanders look to the future with a certain anxiety.

sense.def:
To look up information
pomeni najti podatke tako, da pogledamo v knjigo.

seg.quote: He looked up the meaning of ‘legislation’ in the dictionary.

sense.def:
To look someone up
pomeni nekoga obiskati, potem ko ga dolgo nismo videli;

seg.quote: It was such a fine day he thought he'd look me up.
That summer, things began looking up.

sense.def:
To look upon something as a particular thing
pomeni na nekaj misliti, kot da je določena stvar.

seg.quote: Houses are looked upon as investments.

sense.def:
To look up to someone
pomeni nekoga spoštovati in občudovati.

seg.quote: His younger brothers look up to him.
